column1: length ball, just angles into him a touch at 139.7kph, and Rohit has to defend
fuller, and he drives it down the ground, but Jhye Richardson dives to his left at mid on and cuts this off
full, but down the leg side, and it's an easy put away for Dhawan. Flicks this one, and it races away towards the long leg boundary
length, angles across him at 142.1kph, and he presses forward, taps the ball towards short cover and picks up a quick single
length, and it opens up Rohit a bit as he looks to defend. The ball pops up on its way back to Cummins, but drops short
fuller, straighter, 143.4kph, and he drives this towards short cover
length ball, outside off, shapes away a touch, and he leaves
length, outside off, and shaping further away. Goes at 132.4kph, and Dhawan leaves this alone too
length, straighter, and he taps this towards midwicket
fuller, and he drives this on the up towards long on, but Finch cuts this off diving away to his right, from mid on. Excellent fielding!

length, nips back in. Australia appeal once Carey picks it up. Seems to have hit the pad, though, and Finch agrees. No referral. Good movement back in, that made the ball sneak in past the inside edge
length, outside off, and he leaves this one
length, outside off, and he plays it off the outer part of the bat to the left of point, down to third man
second boundary of the day Full, but again along his leg stump, and he can ease into a drive through midwicket
pitched up around off, and he taps it down towards covers and sets off for a single
jags back in from a length, but would have been going down leg. Rohit seems to have been beaten by pace, though it was 129.9kph
fuller, and he presses forward and drives towards cover
back of a length, and it jags back into him. He presses forward and defends this
length ball, angles into him, and he tries to flick, but misses
length, angles into him, and he defends. Bowled at 131.6kph, but Behrendorff keeping it simple with his line and length
presses forward to a length ball, angling into him, and it almost sneaks in between bat and pad. An inside edge on to his pad, as it drops on the off side
length, angles into him again. He presses forward and gets an inside edge down towards fine leg
fuller, angles across him, and beats an outstretched defensive stroke attempted by Rohit. Sweeeeet!
length, pitches outside leg and then straightens into him. Rohit is squared up and defends awkwardly
length, and he goes up on his toes and punches this through the covers. Jhye Richardson stops it sliding to his right, after chasing this from short cover
shot! Full, straight, and he eases into a straight drive. Keeps it straight enough to give no chance to the man at cover (almost wide mid-off). Good timing
length, and he goes back and drops it towards point
fuller, straighter, and this time he dismisses it with a flick of the wrists. Hits it through midwicket. Superb placement!
presses forward and defends a length ball this time
length, and he defends this from the crease as it angles across him
length, angles across him, and he defends
length ball, and he defends after pressing forward
length, straightens into him, and he tucks it off his pads towards square leg
length ball, and he just eases into a punch through extra cover. Terrific shot...Dhawan and only Shikhar looks like he's in a good mood today!
fuller, outside off, and he presses forward and defends this one. Times it sweetly, down to mid off
length, and he punches this again, and Shaun Marsh makes a good stop at short extra cover. Saves his team three!
length, and he punches this to short extra cover
short, a bit of width, and he cuts this one sharply, bisecting a gap between point and short backward point
length, outside off, and he goes for a big shot but misses
length, outside off, and he eases into yet another drive. Cummins at wide mid off dives away to his right to stop it from piercing the infield
fuller, towards the pads, and Rohit gets this away with a flick, but cannot beat square leg
length, but width, and Rohit this time eases into a gorgeous cover drive. Just transferred his weight into the shot, and it sped away
length ball, angles into him, and he flicks this away towards long leg
fuller, and he drives this towards point. A slight misfield from Khawaja at that position allows them to go through for a comfortable single
length, angles into him, and he presses forward to defend
fuller, straighter into him, and he launches into a fierce on-drive, but cannot beat mid on this time
length, just outside off, and he punches this through covers again. Timing...nothing but timing...
fuller, on the pads, and he whips this away towards midwicket. Wasn't far off from the short midwicket fieldsman, but this is good, positive batting from Dhawan
fires this across Rohit, who drives but cannot beat short cover
length ball, straighter, and he defends this back to the bowler
fuller, and he drives this towards wide mid on
fuller, straighter, and again he drives straight to wide mid on
fuller, and this time he plays it late, but cannot beat short midwicket with a checked drive
straight, down the pads, and he plays it away to short midwicket
length, comes back into him, and he drives it towards cover and sets off for a quick single
fuller length, and he launches into this one. Just a half-step towards the ball and lifts this over long on. Good timing on this one!
length, straighter, and he defends this one from the crease
shorter, angles across him, and he can just nudge this down towards third man
short, and he swivel-pulls this away, but there's now protection at long leg
fuller, on the pads, and he can flick this away towards square leg
short, wide, and Rohit waits for it...and then punches this through extra cover, past point
fuller, and he drives this on the move forward, and gets two as it goes to the left of long off
fuller, wider and he punches this towards point
fuller, and he punches this straighter ball towards midwicket
fuller, and he punches this towards long off

length, outside off, and he drives this. The man at point is able to get his fingers to it, but cannot stop it from trickling towards backward point. They get three, as Australia have some trouble in sending the return in quickly enough
short, angles into him, and he flicks this with soft hands towards square leg
short, angles across him, and he punches this towards the sweeper at backward point
length, angles into him, and he presses forward before flicking this towards square leg
shorter ball, angles across him at 135kph, and Dhawan ducks under this one
length, angles across him, and he punches this to the left of mid off. Sets off immediately, and makes it easily in the end
full, down the pads, and he has flicked this away. Supreme placement, gets it between fine leg and backward square leg
length ball, angles into him, and he plays this towards short midwicket
tossed up, and he drives this with the turn into him, down towards mid on
fuller, straighter, and he drives down to long on, eluding a diving Zampa's hands
length, goes on with the angle, and he goes back and punches this to mid on
flighted, goes on with the angle again, and he presses forward and watchfully pushes it towards point
presses forward and pushes a length ball towards short cover's right
full, straight, and punches this down the ground to bring up FIFTY. Beats mid off comfortably. It's been a really good innings to watch
short ball, and he gets into position for the pull, but can only get it down towards long leg
slower ball, outside off, and he runs it down towards third man. Bowled at just 113.8kph
short, and angles into him. Dhawan has to rise up on his toes to defend this. Good ball!
slower ball, straight at him, and he whips it off his pads towards midwicket. Not off the middle, but wide enough of long leg to get two on what is a fairly small outfield
short, comes back into him at 134.4kph, and he defends from the crease
flights this outside off, and he drives this towards extra cover
short, and he goes back to launch this towards midwicket. There's fielder at backward square leg, where this ball goes though
short again, and this time Rohit stands and just lobs this down towards long on
goes back and punches a length ball towards midwicket
length ball, keeps low as it turns away from him, and he plays a cut over it
length ball, jags back and beats his defensive shot, but goes down the leg, evidently. Polite appeal, but Zampa moves on
short, down the leg side, and he glances it to fine leg
short, and he moves across the crease, hops on to his toes and flicks this away towards square leg
fuller, towards the legs, and he flicks this away towards long leg
short, outside off, and he looks to force this through the off side, but hits it hard on to the ground and fielded by short cover
length, outside off, and he comes forward to drive this towards short cover
length ball, comes back into him, and he defends
flighted, towards his pads, and he makes some room and pushes this away wide of mid on
length ball, that comes back in somewhat after pitching, and Rohit defends from the crease. Good ball, as it didn't turn at all, as Rohit anticipated
length, angles in with the arm, and he punches this down the ground to long
fuller, straighter, and he presses forward to flick this towards deep midwicket
short ball, but Rohit is happy to sit back and punch it down to long on
length ball, and he goes back and punches this to short cover
shorter, outside off, and he looks to drive, but inside-edges this on to his pads. Rapid, at 138.9kph
length, outside off, and he pushes this towards extra cover
short, and he looks to have a swing towards fine leg. Down the leg side, and he will have to bowl this again. Carey does well to hold on to it
short, hits him on the thigh pads, as he shapes to flick. Drops away towards square leg
length, outside off, 136.6kph, and he taps this towards point
length, straight, and he defends this from the crease
short, outside off, and he punches this off the back foot towards extra cover
slides one across, Rohit uses the depth of the crease to lace this behind point. Excellent work by Jhye, throwing himself to his right after running around from deep cover.
Dhawan plays it towards mid-off, short cover runs around to intercept the push. Well done
drifts into middle and leg, defended. Was looking to nudge it round the corner
nice flight, lands on off, driven back to Maxi
too short, and picked away! Pressure releases with that long hop as Dhawan hammers this over midwicket
driven hard to long-off to keep strike
tucks this back to the bowler
steps out, bowler shortens length, punched wide of mid-on
eased with the spin to long-off
googly, Dhawan waits, waits and then steers this length ball to deep point
yorker-length on middle, late drift in, jammed away
steps out and belts this full toss back, Zampa parries this to cover as he bravely put his left hand out to stop. Must sting him for a bit

near repeat of the stroke he played in the previous over, except he's clobbered this into the stands at deep midwicket. Too short from Maxi, it's like inviting someone to have free lassis at Pal Dhaba in Chandigarh No one is going to refuse.
tucks this length delivery into the leg side.
eases with the spin to deep point
too short, punched to deep point
driven with the spin to long-off
gentle bunt wide of cover for a quick single
drifting into middle and leg, tucked behind square
slow turn off a length on middle and leg, worked wide of midwicket
works this full toss to long-on
gets right to the pitch and bunts this down to long-off
fired full and flat outside off, Rohit laces one to sweeper cover to bring up his 40th ODI half-century
works this full delivery from outside off towards deep midwicket
eased to square third man as they jog the single
runs down to third man again for an easy single
works this down to long-on. This is excellent cricket
length on off, lovely flick of the wrists to pick it towards deep midwicket. Aggressive running, the boundary rider caught napping
nice and full on off from round the stumps, deflected to third man
hit high on the thigh pad as he looks to whip this square.
drift and turn off a length on middle, he lunges forward and blocks
steps out but the length isn't quite there, steers into the gap at deep point. Excellent work by Handscomb
muscled over deep midwicket! Too short, asking for punishment.
driven with the spin to long-off, Rohit has passed 3000 ODI runs in India. Average of 62. Incredible
hit on the pad as he looks to work it with the spin through square leg
punched to long-on
mistimes a forceful drive to mid-off
works across the line but straight to mid-on
lack of width, looking to force that on the up but it rolls back off a thick inside edge.
veers back in late, Dhawan surprised by the late movement, ball lobs nearly back to the bowler off an inside edge
too short, he pulls all along to deep midwicket
tucks this wide of square leg, tight over.
eased with the spin to long-off
short, spinning in, tucked to short fine
keeps low, punches the length ball back
shortish outside off, punched to sweeper cover
waits for the turn and tucks this between square leg and midwicket
makes a hint of room and punches to cover.
length ball that nips back in from outside off, punched back to the bowler.
slapped to deep cover, too short and is lucky to get away with that
slips one back in on a length from round the stumps, turned to short midwicket
drives by opening the bat face late to beat point, excellent stop to keep it to a single.
tucks this nicely towards long leg
can't pierce the ring, straight to cover.
defended back as he tosses it up
fiercely swept to deep square! Too short and down leg, Rohit picks that away without a trace of worry.
driven back to Finch, looped it up nicely there
driven with the spin to long-off, sensible
skids one through on a length, punched to long-on
goes for the big hit, doesn't quite connect. Steps out and drags this one off a thick inside-edge to long-on
driven firmly but straight to mid-off

uses the width to smear this length ball towards deep point, superb effort by Marsh, running across and then flicking the ball back one-handed despite the momentum and balance taking him over the ropes. Relayed that superbly to the third man fielder who converged
delightful timing! Length ball and he laces this on the up wide of cover. Allowed the ball to skide on
hits the thigh pad as Rohit attempts the Natraja shot - Left leg in the air, off his hip - towards deep square, rolls wide of the keeper
length on off, punched to deep cover
punched to deep cover, lovely timing. Back for the second very easily
punched to long-off
slices this cut to pierce the gap between point and short third man
whips this down to long-on
mistimes this back, upset at missing out
doesn't quite find the gap at deep square on the sweep, nicely timed though for a couple
short, drifting in, Rohit pulls to beat short fine. Ends with a boundary to break the shackles.
cramped for room, tucks to midwicket
whips this into the gap at deep midwicket, long chase for Marsh and he manages to somehow pull it back in
short, down leg and helped along one bounce to fine leg. Dhawan swiveled nicely
flayed on the up to sweeper cover
too short, and it was as if Rohit was waiting for it. Set himself up and walloped the pull when it arrived. These two going neck and neck

he's holed out to deep midwicket, no century for Rohit and Australia have a big breakthrough.  This sat up for him to play the pull, intention right, execution a little off as he got it off the lower half of the bat. What a disappointment for the crowd
shortish on off, punched to long-off
drift and sharp turn off a length on middle, tucked to the leg side
gentle push into the off side to get off the mark
the skiddy length ball on middle and off, works this across to long-on
gets to the pitch and drives to long-off

paddled fine, too easy. There's the hundred, and the Gabbar celebration. Couldn't have asked for an easier delivery to get there. Too short, too much leg side and he got enough bat on it. Dhawan's 16th ODI ton
shortish ball on middle, punched to long-on
driven sweetly to deep cover
goes right back and across to nudge to the leg side
rocks back and cuts to deep point, nice timing, Khawaja comes round the corner.
steps out and wrists this to long-on
mistimes the drive to cover
drives this low full toss to deep cover
steps out, gets too close to the pitch but squeezes this to long-on
gentle little nudge to short midwicket
fired full on leg stump, Rahul rooted to the crease but somehow nudges this
walks into this drive to deep point
swept hard, but well stopped at short fine. Dhawan was blindly ambling until he suddenly saw Rahul's outstretched right hand saying 'nooooooooo'
shot had the cheekiness of his Karnataka mate Robin Uthappa - a reverse paddle, but straight to short third man
tucks wide of short midwicket for a quick single
steps out, not quite to the pitch but goes through and clears deep cover. Amazing punch in the stroke.
he seems to tell Rahul 'now that's how you play the reverse.' Beats the diving short third man fielder. Lovely touch, lovely timing.
bunts wide of point for a quick single
punched to long-on
length ball, and he drops it down to square leg to pinch a single
short, and he swings this around to long leg. Bad ball, and he gives it due punishment
length, angles across him and he is forced to defend as it makes him jump with the extra bounce. Effort ball from Cummins
walks across the stumps and glides a slower ball down towards long leg. It's gone wide of the man stationed there, to his left, and he sprints back for the second
fuller, outside off, and he looks to drag this down the wicket, but hits it hard back on to the pitch. Cummins fields on his follow-through
short, and he waits for this one, and swings it around to beat fine leg. Fine shot, especially because this was delivered north of 136kph. Top stuff, Shikhar!
fuller ball, straighter, and he is square up as he is forced to defend
length, and he is forced on to the back foot to defend this towards short midwicket
fuller ball, angles into him, and he plays it late, guiding it down to third man
full, and he flicks this beautifully off his pads. All the way through midwicket. Terrific timing...WOOF!
slower ball, and he moves away to the on side and then goes through with a lofted shot. Over wide long off
full, straight, and he biffs this towards midwicket. Almost stopped by the man down there, but he has allowed this to slip through his fingers
length, and he stands up tall and punches this towards extra cover
makes room, and slogs this one straight down the wicket. Pierces the gap between mid off and cover. Shot!
shorter ball, strays down the pads and he looks to biff this down towards fine leg, but Carey stops it as it races away. Took a bit of glove, which is why it didn't go as fast as he wanted it to
wider of the crease, angles across him, and misses the tramline down the leg side. Called wide, though he came close to getting some bat down to this. Would probably have flown over fine leg!

GONE THIS TIME! Straightens into him as he shapes to hoick this over midwicket. Loses his shape, and it sneaks in between his bat and body and clips the top of middle. Standing ovation for a terrific ODI knock. Just never allowed the momentum of the innings to drop
Kohli starts with a trademark flick from a length ball at his pads, but it is fielded by short midwicket
strays on to the pads, and he flicks this away towards long leg. The man at fine leg has some work to do to get to his left, but is able to cut this off
length ball, comes back into him and he drops this towards square leg. Kohli wants two...and gets two. Good response from Rahul too
length ball, and he drops this at the crease as it comes back into him
length ball, outside off, and he drops it towards extra cover with soft hands
length, outside off, and he thrashes this through extra cover...but to the sweeper stationed for exactly this shot
fuller ball, and he drives this on the up, gets it past short extra cover
walks across a length ball, outside off, and flicks this one off his face down to fine leg. Quite a remarkable shot, this! But when do you associate Kohli with the ordinary...
short, and he cuts it fiercely, but cannot beat point
length, outside off, and he drops it towards third man with a roll of the wrists
length, and comes back into him, and he cannot get any timing on an intended drive

full ball, wide and he gets an outside edge to this. It's been taken by Carey, and Kumara Dharmasena is sending it upstairs. The soft signal is out for caught behind. The replays don't look conclusive at first glance, but there needs to be conclusive evidence to overturn this, remember. It's given out, and there won't be a century no. 42 for Virat Kohli here. Still lots of batting to come, of course...
angles across him, and he defends this towards point
angles across him, length ball, and he presses forward and flicks this towards backward square leg
length ball, outside off, and he punches this towards short cover
nudges a length ball, angling into him towards midwicket. He wants two, but has to turn Rahul down as the fielder rushes on to this
fuller ball, straighter, and he drives this towards wide long on
slower ball, straight, and he nurdles this towards midwicket, and zips through for the second
length ball, and he goes back and punches this to the right of short cover
fuller ball, and he sweeps this fine. Gets four! There was even an appeal from the bowler, but just got enough bat on this. Makes this a good over overall for India. Nine off it!
length, outside off, and he leans into a gorgeous cover drive. Didn't over hit it, just placed it between long off and extra cover
length, strays on to the pads and he can nurdle this away to the right of long leg. Has played it soft enough to push for two and get there easily
full ball, into him, and he flicks this one imperiously! Superb timing again, as he places this to the left of midwicket, inside the circle
wide ball, full, and he looks to drive. Gets the outer edge, but it flies off the blade and eludes Carey...all the way down to the third man boundary
full toss on off stump, and he biffs this down to long off
full toss, straight, and he drives this down to long on to retain strike
tosses this up outside off, Rahul comes down the wicket and eases this through cover
bowled from wide of the crease, angles across him, and he goes back to punch this, but cannot beat short cover
slides on across him again, and he goes back and swats this down towards extra cover
Rahul uses his feet, Zampa shortens the length, angles across him, and he is forced to play this towards midwicket
fuller, outside off, and he flicks this away towards deep mdwicket

looks for a late cut, and gets the outside edge. Good take by Carey! Waits for the umpire to raise his finger. Smart bowling from Zampa, just tossed it up a bit, and on off stump, and the little turn took the outside of the bat. Fifty ODI wickets for Adam Zampa too
full ball, and he drives this towards long on
length ball, and he looks to drive, but can only get it back down the wicket with the turn
fuller ball, angles across him, and he eases this down towards midwicket
full, outside off, and he runs it down to the right of short third man
full, fast, and straight, and he is forced to drive this down to long on
short, and he goes back in trying to biff this, but under-edges it towards midwicket. Maxwell chases this, and keeps it down to just one
shot! It was a length ball, angling across him as Zampa has wanted to do. Pant uses his feet and then launches this over long on. Gets it straight too
this time he switches hands and wants to go fine towards third man, but smashes it onto his right leg. Doesn't really go anywhere, with a full ball
shorter, and he swivels around and gets this down towards long leg. The fieldsman puts in a game effort, but just fails to pull it back before it hits the boundary skirting
smartly bowled! Comes from wide of the crease, and pushes this across him. Pant was looking to go straight, and adjusts late to drive it back to the bowler on the off side
flat, wide of off stump, and he can only thrash this down to long off
fuller, straighter and he nudges this down to long on
length, outside off, and he runs it down to third man
length, outside off, and he looks to go down the ground, but the bat turns in his hand. Skews the shot towards the onside

straight down Finch's throat at mid on! Cummins floated this wide of the off stump again, and with mid on inside the circle, Pant took the invitation of wanting to clear him. Toe-ends this, and Finch takes a smart, low catch to his left. This could cost India an odd 15-20 runs right here
short, outside off, and he runs it down towards third man
fuller, on off stump, and he nudges it with soft hands towards midwicket. They want two, and make it look ridiculously easy. Good running!
length ball, cuts back into him, and Jadhav blocks this after taking a half-step towards the ball
banged in short, and he gets up on his toes and flicks this away towards backward square leg
banged in short, and takes Jadhav by surprise too. Starts from middle and goes further down leg, though, and he will need to go again
short, and he picks this from outside off and drags it down towards long leg
short, and again down the leg side. Shankar had taken a little step away towards the off side, but it was still way wide of his waft as he looked to play this down to fine leg
short again, and he picks this up from outside his off stump and takes it down towards backward square leg. They get two for this
fuller ball, faster this time at 136.2kph, and it goes off the inside edge and then drops off his pads in to the off side. Richardson had a quiet appeal going, but withdrew
short, outside off, and he taps this towards square leg. Chides himself for not making good enough contact on what was a loose ball
fuller, straighter, and he drives this towards mid on
length, outside off, and he forces this towards extra cover
shorter ball, and he chips down the wicket and punts this down towards mid on
length ball, straight at him, and he flicks this towards deep midwicket
short, down the leg side, and he pulls this away towards long leg
shorter ball, outside off, and he looks to loft this down the ground. Flies off the outside edge, and just clears point

short ball, he uses his feet to get closer to it and then swings this away...and straight down long leg's throat! The pressure of not getting boundaries shows as Jadhav looks to force the pace. Smart adjustment from Cummins to hold the length back, and he ends up mis-timing the attempted hoick completely. Needed to get it more off the middle of the bat to clear the fielder
short ball, and he moves away from the crease to create some room, and whacks this straight down the ground. Just clears the long off fence
lofts a length ball over mid on. Good strokeplay to get some much-needed momentum right at the end for India!
short, and he looks to swing this around the leg side. Misses contact, and the bounce ahead of Carey takes the ball away and allows them to steal a bye
length ball, and he goes back and nudges this down towards fine leg
short again, and he pushes this away handsomely towards long leg

short ball, and he looks to dink this over Carey with a delicate dab, but Carey goes across to his right to take this with his right hand! Today has seen an excellent exhibition of 'keeping from Carey, with this the third smart catch he has picked up
length, and he has gone over long on, and timed it well enough to clear the man at that position. The ball was angling into him, at good pace, and he used that expertly
fired wider, and fuller, and he has a waft, but fails to make contact
length ball, down the leg side, and he looks to flick this, but it is called wide

short, and he looks to go over midwicket, but cannot clear Glenn Maxwell! Cummins bangs this one into the pitch, and that takes the top edge, and Maxwell holds his shape well at midwicket and takes a steepling catch. Useful little hand has come to an end, that has pushed India over the minimum score India would have wanted to post today
short, angles across him, and he pats this towards point

FIVE for Cummins! Bangs this in short, and Chahal is squared up as he looks to drive this back. It pops back up, and Cummins takes it, but Dharmasena this time goes up to the third ump, and gives not out as the soft signal. The replays are conclusive though. All clean. Good effort this from Cummins on what is not a helpful pitch by any stretch of imagination

length, and he has swung this around, and cleared midwicket! What a shot, and Kohli is jumping up and down with excitement inside the dressing room. Bumrah walks off with a wide grin, and pumps fists with Kuldeep Yadav as he does so. 600 strike rate for the no.11...not too shabby, eh?
raps him the pad, appeal, not out. Hooping the ball back in a long way, Finch plays all around it but the ball deflects off the thigh pad for a leg bye
searching for swing but bowls this full and down leg, wide.
angles one across, left alone. No swing
tucks this wide of midwicket for an easy single

knocked him over! Bhuvi, you beauty. Age-old issues against the moving ball, especially the big inswinger for Finch. This is full, starts from outside off but nips back in to sneak through the huge gap between bat and pad. Crashes into the leg stump.
nice and full on off, pushed to mid-off, gets off the mark immediately.
zips one across, left alone
gets this to slant across on a length, left alone
short of length delivery angling away, Marsh leaves
fuller and straighter on middle, defended back
shortens his length a hint, takes it across, left alone. On the bounce to Pant
gets a thick edge all along the ground to third man
drives, gets a thick inside edge to fine leg. Lucky break
right behind the line as he defends
nice and full on off, driven to mid-off. Not much movement in the air this time for Bhuvi
steered to square third man as they jog the single
opens him up with the late movement from middle, defended nonetheless
bunts this down to point
delightful drive. Too much width, Marsh forces this into the gap between point and cover.
looks to drive through cover, not quite to the pitch. The inside edge rolls to short midwicket
runs it down to third man

goes right through him! Goes wide of the crease, bowls full and gets it to angle away, Marsh plays outside the line and ends up getting yorked nearly. This one tailed in just a hint to sneak through to crash into the stumps.
toe-ends a push, chopped down to third man where Jadhav was caught napping. Off the mark with a streaky boundary
thick edge again as he looks to punch, Jadhav didn't have to move an inch at third man
gets it off a thick inside edge to short midwicket
pushed back towards mid-on, mix-up but they don't take a run in the end and rightly so
skiddy length ball back into middle and leg, defended
shows the full face of the bat to defend this
stands tall and punches this to mid-off
delightful punch on the up through extra cover, tracer bullet stuff
defends this incoming length ball solidly
lovely on-drive, mid-on parries it to mid-off on the dive, single.
works this off his pads, timing superb and it keeps gathering speed. Dhawan in pursuit, sliding stop as he runs back from square leg
off a thick inside edge onto the pad, rolls to square leg. Was rooted to the crease trying to whip this full delivery
eases this down to square third man
steered down to square third man
toe-ends the drive to cover point
steered down to third man
length on off, punched to Rohit at cover
punches this length ball to mid-off
drives using the full face, Bhuvi deflects it to mid-on. Khawaja, backing up too far, had to dive to get back in. Would've been out had Bhuvi deflected this onto the stumps
gets half-forward and pushes to mid-off
uppish but lands short of mid-on. Was looking to work this cross-seam length ball from outside off through midwicket
slants one full, firm push to mid-off
excellent pick up shot. Length on the pads and he whips this uppishly through square leg. Too straight
imperious! Balance and timing superb as he flicks him nonchalantly through midwicket. Too full and drifting into the pads this time
eases to third man
defends this length ball on the stumps with soft hands
punched on the up but straight to point

walks into the stroke as he flicks through midwicket. Manufactured the length because of the couple of steps he took. Superb. If I was the DJ, I'd play the bollywood sound track Khawaja mere khawaja for that
gets half a stride in and defends. Presumably to negate any late movement Bhuvi may get here
whips this to deep square
off a thickish inside edge to mid-on, this one thudded into the bat
superb stop by Rohit, diving to his left to stop this one-handed at cover. Was smashed on the up
slower length ball on off, punched to mid-off.
length ball on the stumps, punched to mid-off
gentle away-movement from length on off, pushed to mid-off
just short of mid-on! Fell over awkwardly did Bumah as he dived forward to catch this mishit.
works this off a thick inside edge to mid-on for a quick single
sublime drive, sublime timing, outstanding fielding by Kohli at mid-off to stop a certain boundary
chipped but well short of mid-on and they'll scamper a run
steps out and drives to mid-off, got to the pitch nicely
cuts to deep point
shortish delivery on middle and leg, whips to deep square
cut away to deep point, too short again
makes room and cuts to short third man, this one didn't come on at all. Stopped just a touch
steps out and drives to long-off
sprays one onto the pads, flicked to deep midwicket
nice and full on the stumps, punched back. Good stop off his own bowling
driven nicely to deep point, opened the bat face late to pick the gap.
punched down to long-on
eased straight to point, tight line. Good start so far for Vijay
works this length ball on middle to long-on
drops short, he makes room and cuts to deep point
dipped on him but he works it with the spin nonetheless to mid-on
works this down to long-on
sweeps dangerously to a full delivery on the stumps, gets a thick inside edge to deep square
punched to deep cover
gets outside the line of the stumps this time, rolls his wrists over the delivery to keep this sweep all along the ground to fine leg
back of a length on off, punched to deep point
works this off length towards wide long-on
slower length ball, punched to long-on
looked to play a short-arm jab but was cramped for room, deflects off the thigh pad to the keeper on the bounce. Stifled appeal from Vijay but it pitched well outside leg.
walks into the stroke to whip this square but Vijay bowls this way outside leg
wrists this to deep midwicket where Chahal comes in
length on middle and leg, works to deep midwicket
backs away to cut, ends up chopping it to the covers.
driven through the line to long-off.
fired full, Jadhav rooted to the crease as he pushes at the delivery, squirted to point
once again fired full, squeezed wide of point
steps out and works this down to long-on
punches into the gap at cover for a single to keep strike
works this against the line towards midwicket
walks into the stroke as he punches this to mid-off
makes room and squeezes the drive to mid-off for a quick single
too full on the pads, whipped to deep midwicket
sliding into the pads, worked nicely down to deep midwicket
super stroke that! Too full and he laces this through the covers, sublime timing.
length ball, and he skips down the wicket and whips this through midwicket. Takes it over the infield, and places it well between long on and deep midwicket
tossed up, but down leg side. He goes for the sweep, and gets it down to fine leg
tossed up, and Khawaja takes it on the full outside off, drives it away to backward point
slow, hangs outside off, and he dabs this away towards backward point. Good effort from Vijay Shankar who chases it down from point, and pulls it back for a colleague. They pick up three, though
flighted, and he drives this towards short cover
wide of the crease, flatter and straighter, and he punches it through covers. Virat Kohli tries valiantly to stop this away to his left, but can't
length ball, angles across him from middle to off, and he drives it to mid off
length ball, on the pads, and he whips this away towards long leg. Kuldeep puts in the slide, and cannot prevent a boundary, as his left foot touches the rope as he looks to stop this
length ball, jumps off a good length as it angles across him. He wants to run this through third man, but it just eludes his edge before going through to Pant
fuller, and he drives this from outside off down to long on
dragged short, down the leg side, and Handscomb biffs it away, but cannot place it beyond long leg
full, wide and he drives this through extra cover. Fifty for Khawaja!
tossed up, and he gets down on his knee and sweeps this very well. Places it between fine leg and deep backward square leg. Top shot!
tossed up wide, and he drives this square towards backward point
tossed up, and he drives this towards long off
tossed up, and he goes back to tuck this away towards square leg
tossed up, and he drives this off middle stump towards midwicket
flighted, and he defends a length ball
tosses this up on leg stump, Handscomb uses his feet and glides this down towards fine leg
flatter, straighter, 86.1kph, and he pushes this towards long on
tossed up, wide of off, and he presses forward to defend this
short, and he rocks back and biffs this towards deep midwicket. It actually bounces short of the fielder stationed in the deep
uses his feet to get to a length ball, and plays it down the ground towards long on
length, turns back in, and beats the inside edge. Just misses off stump, and beats Pant too! Tentative forward prod from Khawaja
short, and he goes back to one that turns into him and cuts it away from in front of leg stump towards point
reverse sweep to a length ball, and gets it towards backward point. The man there has to run to his right, and they pick up two
flighted, in his arc, and he drives this through covers
chips down the wicket and check-drives a length ball in the air...but safely towards long off
goes for the reverse sweep to a length ball outside off, and misses out on contact. Polite appeal
tossed up, and he drives this back with the turn back at Yadav
flatter, straighter, and he goes back to cut this towards point
short, and wide, and he cuts this towards the sweeper at the backward point fence

tossed up, and he pulls out the reverse sweep this time. Gets it past the infield, and it rolls away to the backward point fence. Was fired in quicker, and he just used the pace on it to guide it with his wrists
flighted, and he uses his feet to skip to it, before flicking it away towards deep midwicket
flighted, on the leg stump, and he lofts this over the infield on the on side and picks up two before deep midwicket can get around to field this
tossed up, he uses his feet and gets this down to long on
full toss on off stump, and he guides this from outside off stump to the leg side...and finds the gap between long leg and deep backward square leg!
full toss again, and he sweeps this one but cannot beat long leg
fuller ball, on the pads, and he drives this down the ground towards wide long on
fuller ball, on off, he sweeps this, but gets an inside edge on to the ground, and his boot
tossed up, and he presses forward to defend this towards short midwicket
makes room, the ball turns away from him, and he cuts it straight towards point
tossed up, around his leg stump, and he shuffles across and guides this down towards fine leg with a fine lap shot
uses his feet to get closer to a length ball tossed up outside off, and flicks this wristily towards midwicket
fuller ball, he goes back looking to guide this towards third man. It comes off the outside edge, and hits Pant on the leg. Can't call this a chance...
tossed up, and he sweeps this. The ball stops on him a bit and skews towards deep backward square leg
tossed up, and he looks to flick. The ball comes off his pads, and beats Pant, who was busy appealing. Good ball and unluckily to concede runs...
short, and he goes back and chops this one away on the off side, towards backward point
short, and he goes back to punch this, but cannot beat short cover

tossed up, and he comes forward looking to flick this. Do they want to review this? Pant suggesting there could have been some bat on this. Kohli wonders for a bit, but allows this to pass. Struck him on the pad, and clearly in line. Just an inside edge, though
short ball, and he back-cuts this, and Bumrah makes a mess of looking to field it. Almost pops this down to the third man boundary
uses his feet to a length ball outside off, and forces this towards extra cover
short, and he goes back and tries to hoick this towards midwicket. Inside-edges this on to his pads. Didn't miss the stumps by much!
flighted outside off, and he looks to drive. Takes the outer edge and rolls down to Bumrah at short third man
chip shot, inside out, to a length ball, outside off, and it eludes the man at long off, allowing enough time to get through for two
uses his feet to a length ball outside off, and flicks this towards deep midwicket
uses his feet to skip down the pitch, and flick a length ball on the pads towards deep backward square leg
length, and he fetches this from the middle stump and sweeps it away from short fine leg. Good shot!
length, and he goes back and cuts, but Rohit Sharma cuts it off at point
flighted, outside off, and he looks to swing this down towards midwicket. A bit of extra turn, and it beats his outside edge, and Pant makes a clean take this time
length, outside off, and he sweeps this firmly, in front of square. Vijay Shankar runs around from deep backward square leg and cuts this off
full toss, and he looks to reverse lap this...and only goes to short third man
shimmies down the pitch to convert a length ball into a full toss, and hits it to long off
uses his feet to get to a length ball, and it turns a bit extra and takes the inner part of his bat as he drives. He is able to get it down to long on
short, turns away from him, and he cuts this towards backward point. Some work to do for Jadhav, running away to his right, and they come back for the second
length, turns away, and he punches it off the back foot, but cannot beat point
inside-edges a full ball towards short fine leg
drives a length ball with the turn towards long on
tries to over-hit a length ball, and can only find short cover
tossed up, and he takes it from outside leg towards long on
cuts a short ball, but cannot get enough timing on it to beat point
flatter, faster, and he is forced to defend this after shaping to cut
drives a length ball towards long off
fuller ball, outside off, and he is forced to play this towards point
tries to cut a short ball, but cannot beat point
fuller ball, and he runs this towards long on
uses his feet to get to this, Kuldeep fires it wider, and he drives it straight towards long off
uses his feet to drive this fuller ball outside off towards backward point
plays the paddle lap sweep towards short third man
uses his feet, and drives a length ball towards long on
flighted, and he looks to go towards midwicket. Didn't time it well at all, and lucky, because it lands short of Kedar Jadhav at the fence there
uses his feet to this, and deposits this a few rows back over long on. Top shot from Handscomb, and much-needed intent!
uses his feet, and hits a crisp low shot towards long on. Has Khawaja jumping out of the way of the speeding ball
sharp turn back in as it pitches on leg, and he makes room to cut. Jams the bat down on it, and runs it down towards short fine leg
fired low and wide, and he drives this towards extra cover
drags the length back seeing Handscomb advance, and he drives it towards extra cover

full ball, and he looks to sweep. Will they refer this? They do! He appeared to miss the ball, but it could have been spearing down leg. Remember, it's been given by Dharmasena, and Australia have reviewed this. No inside edge, and he did shuffle a long way across in looking to sweep. Down to the tracker now. Oh, it's missing by a mile!
length ball, goes for a cut and misses. Was fired in a bit quicker
fired in outside off again, and he plays it away towards short cover
tossed up, outside off, and he drives this down to long on
length ball, on off stump, and he backs away and drives it towards backward point
length, and he drives this on the up, but cannot beat short cover
length, outside off, and he taps this towards extra cover and picks up a single
length ball, straighter at him, and he drives this down to long on
short, 142.4kph, and he swings this around to long leg
length, outside off, and he drives this towards point
takes a conventional lap to a fuller ball outside off, and gets it to short fine leg
flat ball, and he comes down the track and hoicks this one straight back. SIX! Quite a remarkable shot, almost like a forehand crosscourt!
wallops another flat one on the stumps, and gets it over long on. Is this the over?
tossed up, and he takes it on the full and drives this down to long on
reverse sweep again, and KL Rahul saves this at point, diving away to his right. Would have been four if he had missed this
uses his feet, and drives this through covers. Terrific shot, takes him to 99

superb catch running in from fine leg! Bumrah peppers him with a short ball from round the stumps, Khawaja hurried onto the pull, clearly late on it and gets a top edge. Kuldeep was late to run in but he certainly wasn't in any dilemma about not going for the catch. It was dying on him when he threw himself forward, managed to cup his hands underneath the ball. Big moment in the game, a monumental stand has been broken, but that said, it may not be a bad thing for Australia as it brings in Maxwell's firepower.
wrists this wide of mid-on, tremendous use of the bottom hand to whip this from outside off. Wow, dazzling to say the least.
beauty! Zip off the pitch as it angles in, Maxwell beaten as he was looking to run it down
backs away and slaps this length ball straight to point
short, angling in and Maxwell helps this leg-stump delivery past the keeper to beat fine leg.
swings blindly, gets a thick inside edge to midwicket. He was looking to hit this to the stands over long-on
punched to mid-off for a quick single
bunts this to point, Maxwell was five steps down the pitch when he was sent back.
back of a length angling into middle and leg, tucked to midwicket
sways out of the way of this slower bouncer outside off, in anticipation of it being called wide

through with a half-hearted pull, but the ball rolls off the thin edge onto the body and to the off side. Maiden ODI century for Handscomb , terrific knock. Talk about making a statement. That should give him some wings and some miles later in the summer. Air miles to the UK, I mean.
turns this length ball from outside off to midwicket
ferocious sweep to deep midwicket, superb stop by Vijay sliding to his left
drifts in and skids through to hit pad as Maxwell plays all around it, sliding down.
fired full, eased to long-off
fired full again, pushed to long-off
he's walloped this over the ropes. Didn't get hold of the pull, lost his shape but still managed to clear. Too short, used the depth of the crease to rock back and play the shot he wanted.
bowls it full and wide, swept from outside off towards wide long-on, three runs as Dhawan comes around, a touch slowly.

huge appeal and gone! Maxwell's decision to switch hit hasn't worked, he reviews but it's a very optimistic one. Kuldeep lands this on a length on middle and off, Maxwell's almost sweeping like a left-hander at the point of impact, which is bang on middle. The leg stump was visible at the point of impact. Maxwell has to go. Ball tracking shows all three reds. Kuldeep with a telling blow.
works this down to long-on to get off the mark
steps out and squeezes this with the spin to deep midwicket
sharp turn from length outside off, tucked to square leg
gets a thick inside edge on this googly to midwicket, he was looking to punch through cover.
punched to long-off
squirted off a thick inside edge to short fine leg
flatter one on middle, tucked to the leg side
googly, skiddy one at that, worked to deep midwicket
works this down to long-on
steps out and gets inside the line to ease it to sweeper cover
drilled down to long-off, hit flat.
squirts this to midwicket
hammered back past the bowler, fine shot. Got right to the pitch to smother the turn, long-off had no chance.
swept one bounce to the deep midwicket boundary. Turner is turning on the heat.
tucks this towards deep midwicket
steps out to whip, but misses as Kuldeep shortens his length. Rolls to Pant, who can't grab the ball cleanly to effect the stumping. Huge opportunity missed
pulled into the gap between deep midwicket and wide long-on
bunts this down to the man coming in from long-on
pulled from outside off towards deep midwicket
walloped across the line towards deep midwicket, aggressive running
backs away and slices this low full toss to deep cover

right into the blockhole, Bhuvi will be anguished to see that squirt to the fine leg boundary off an inside edge. How unlucky. Did most things right with that. Oh, you luck man Handscomb. Would've been plumb had that pinned him on the boot
beaten as he looks to work this slower ball towards midwicket
gets underneath the length and muscles this over the bowler's head.
flatter and drifting away, slapped to cover
swept from outside off towards substitute Jadeja at deep midwicket
wallops this full toss towards wide long-on where Kohli runs and puts in a dive to cut off two runs
steps out and punches to deep cover
walks across and smothers this googly back to the bowler.

cleverly done by Chahal, wicket well-deserved and the danger man is gone! Saw him coming and threw it full and wide, Handscomb had to reach out to try and hit it over long-off, toe-ended it and Rahul took a simple catch running in.
looks to flatbat that but misses, beaten
of a thick inside edge, but onto the pad. Looked to slap through cover.
drilled to Rohit at deep cover
fired full on the stumps, works it towards the vacant midwicket region. Having done all the hard work in running in, Rohit misfields because he overran the ball, so they get a third.
he's clubbed that over long-on even though he didn't get to the pitch. Brute force
eases this full delivery to long-on
hits the hard length, angles one back in, defended back
beaten as he looks to wallop this length ball across the line
walks across to scoop fine but the length not there. Maybe Bumrah saw him premeditate and shortened his length. Beaten
makes room, uses the pace and glides this behind point. Pure timing and hand-eye coordination. Stunning.
leading edge, thick one at that to third man

Pant fluffs one down leg, another one goes begging! This one difted in, he's looking to tuck it fine but is overbalanced and well outside the crease. Oh, dear. Oh dear. Are India missing MS Dhoni behind the stumps or what? Pressure beginning to tell
slips another one down leg possibly because of the wet ball, has to rebowl
gentle bunt towards Vijay coming in from deep midwicket, super running
swing across the line exactly to the man there, at midwicket
right into the blockhole, Carey can just manage to squeeze it out somehow, but they hare a single as Pant under-arm flicks wide of the stumps

sees the batsman making room and fires it wide, beaten. India have reviewed a caught behind, but the impression I got is the batsman was through with the shot even before the ball arrived. But they'll look for stumping first, and then for caught behind. Stumping seems fine. They went up for stumping because the square leg umpire went up immediately. <b> India have reviewed for caught behind. Replays confirm a big spike but it was after it passed the bat. End result is, wide.
mistimes a hoick to the edge of the ring at midwicket
forced through the line at extra cover, Vijay comes around the deep to cut that off
beaten on the sweep. Hit on the body.
full, straight, outside off, squeezed to the edge of the ring at cover
goes full on leg stump as Carey tries to back away, deflects off the pad into the leg side.
full toss that has been walloped over wide long-on, tremendous bottom-handed whip. Woah, sensational
pulled one bounce to the deep backward square leg fence, maiden ODI half-century for Turner . What a knock this is turning out to be
squeezes the drive to deep backward point, Vijay comes around to cut that off
this has been walloped deep into the stands at cow corner, mind you that is a big boundary. Not much wrong with the delivery, it's all Turner's brilliance
makes room, Bumrah cramps him for room, but he still bunts it towards the man coming in from deep cover, super running
chopped down to Vijay coming in from deep cover again, superb running. 50 partnership off just 28 balls
backs away and slaps this wide of point. Too much width, super timing. Square third man had no chance.
superb ball, yorker right into his boot from round the stumps, deflects behind the stumps on the off side for a leg bye

what a shot, what-a-shot. Walks across - the guts, the confidence - and scoops this full delivery and even clears fine leg. ABD would've been proud of that. Fielder inside the ring so the shot was on, had the extra pace, executed it beautifully.
steered down to third man
clears long-on. The whip of his bottom hand, tremendous. Walks across and deposits this length ball over the ropes.

Jadhav puts a tough one down at deep midwicket! This mishit was dying on him, Jadhav late to pick it up, late to run in and so couldn't get underneath the delivery. Confused how deep he should've been at the boundary. Oh, dear. Lost control completely
walks across and helps this pull to deep backward square leg, couple of bounces to the ropes.

Dhawan drops a dolly at mid-off! Oh, dear. It's all happening. Low full toss, Bhuvi goes full and wide, Turner toe-ends it, it wasn't even travelling fast. Greasy hands, took it too easy. Pressure, pressure, pressure.
flicks this low full toss, no one at deep square. This has been a poor over from Bhuvi, lack of match practice showing. He's been off the radar tonight
tucks this to square leg
off the pad, down leg, races to the fine leg boundary. One blow away from victory now
bunts this down to the point region
leading edge, rolls down to third man

chipped and Dhawan takes the catch coming in from midwicket. Carey can't finish it off but he's played his part in this partnership. No slap of the thigh, Dhawan style. Tells you the situation of the game, doesn't it?

bunts this down to the vacant mid-on region, there is a huge gap and they hare across for the second. Turner, you beauty. Australia level series 2-2. This is Australia's highest-successful chase v India, fifth-highest overall. What a moment, what a game. What a knock
